value.title: Enabling digital transformation
value.excerpt: Digital transformation is a wave of business innovation fueled by the explosion of technology—data, applications, and devices are everywhere. The cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and the internet of things (IoT) give organizations new ways to make sense of information and generate insights to transform their business. Realizing the benefits of digital transformation requires business leaders to look beyond technology to reimagine existing business models and embrace a different way of bringing together people, data, and processes to create value for customers.

value.title: Explore data storage and processing in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore data storage and processing in Azure

value.title: Explore DevOps Continuous Security and Continuous Operations
value.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Security and Continuous Operations.

value.title: Explore relational data offerings in Azure
value.excerpt: Explore relational data offerings in Azure

value.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Docker to build, store, and manage private container images with the Azure Container Registry.

value.title: Introduction to GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

value.title: Monitor GitHub events by using a webhook with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: Discover the benefits of webhooks when you trigger an Azure function with a GitHub webhook and parse the payload for insights.

value.title: Protect your virtual machine settings with Azure Automation State Configuration
value.excerpt: Learn how to protect your virtual machine settings with Azure Automation State Configuration

value.title: Secure an ASP.NET Core web app with the Identity framework
value.excerpt: Add authentication and authorization to an ASP.NET Core web app using the Identity framework.

value.title: Protect your servers and VMs from brute-force and malware attacks with Azure Security Center
value.excerpt: Stop hackers from getting into your Windows and Linux servers. In this module, you’ll discover how to protect VMs and servers with Azure Security Center

value.title: Choose the best Azure serverless technology for your compute scenario
value.excerpt: Examine Azure's serverless technologies and choose the right service for your scenario.

value.title: Azure API for FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Michael Hansen joins Scott Hanselman to explain what FHIR is and how to get started with FHIR on Azure. Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (or, FHIR) is a new standard for representing and exchanging healthcare data. Developed by the HL7 community to address problems with interoperability, pieces
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5vS7Iq9vpXE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure App Service Web Apps | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Byron Tardif joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure App Service Web Apps, the best way to build and host web applications in the programming language of your choice without managing infrastructure. It offers auto-scaling and high availability, supports both Windows and Linux, and enables automated deployments

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Cosmos DB with Scott Hanselman
value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk stops by Azure Friday to talk Cosmos DB with Scott Hanselman. Watch quick overview of the industry's first globally distributed multi-model database service followed by a demo of moving an existing MongoDB app to Cosmos DB with a single config change.  For more information, see: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cosmos-db/.

value.title: Azure Friday | Visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra shows Donovan Brown how you can now visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2 and be more productive by getting pipelines up & running quickly without writing any code. value.title: Why did Microsoft move from ADAL to MSAL? | One Dev Question: Jean-Marc Prieur
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Jean-Marc Prieur, a Principal Program Manager working on the Microsoft identity platform, explains the advantages of using the Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL) instead of the Azure Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL).   Get more information at: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 4: Describe general security and network security features
value.excerpt: Learn about the various Azure services you can use to help ensure that your cloud resources are safe, secure, and trusted.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Protect against security threats on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure can help you protect the workloads you run both in the cloud and in your on-premises datacenter.

topItems.title: Secure network connectivity on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the various Azure services you can use to help ensure that your network is safe, secure, and trusted.

value.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
value.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data and to create and run stored procedures.

value.title: Analyze the sentiment of reviews with Keras
value.excerpt: Keras is a high-level neural networks API, written in Python, that runs on top of other deep learning tools such as TensorFlow. This module uses Keras to build a neural network that scores text, such as user reviews for sentiment.

images.title: Analyze the sentiment of reviews with Keras

value.title: Choose the best tools to help organizations build better solutions
value.excerpt: Learn about the tools and services that help developers and operations engineers use build modern solutions for the cloud and on-premises.

value.title: Enable automatic updates in a web application using Azure Functions and SignalR Service
value.excerpt: Update a web app's notification mechanism from polling to push-based architecture with SignalR Service, Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions.

value.title: Explore Azure Storage services
value.excerpt: Learn about the different storage options that are available in Azure Storage.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
value.excerpt: Learn how to adjust your capacity based on workload and how to optimize network performance, storage, and database performance.

value.title: Capture and view page load times in your Azure web app with Application Insights
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll configure Application Insights and use it to study page load data for an Azure web app.

value.title: Choose an Agile approach to software development
value.excerpt: Learn with the Space Game web team how to use Azure Boards to implement Agile software practices along with DevOps transparency and collaboration.
